reference.title: Ant Properties for DITA-OT
reference.shortdesc: Reference list of DITA-specific ant properties.

section.p: DITA-OT processes your documentation project as an Ant project, which requires several Ant build properties specific to DITA-OT. Ant properties can be placed in three different places:

Project-specific properties apply to all target defined in your documentation project. Target-specific properties apply only to the output target for which they are defined. Task-specific properties are defined in DITA-OT's scripts and should not be modified.

Although you can use most of the Toolkit's ant properties as either project or target-specific, this guide provides recommendations for where to place them based on criteria such as the directory structure of your content files. debugging considerations, and known issues with DITA-OT 1.5.
The following table describes basic project and task-specific Ant properties that appear in most DITA-OT projects.

row.entry: Defines the location of a file containing your custom document footer.
Defines the location of a configuration file for the FO Plugin used by the DITA-OT to generate PDF output.
Defines the location of a file containing your custom document header.
Defines the location of the .ditamap file for your documentation project. DITA-OT reads this file to find the .dita files that comprise the content for the documentation project.

Defines the location of a DITA-OT filter file. Filter files are used to define which topics are not included in the generated document. Alternatively, you can filter topics from your output by creating a different .ditamap file for each version of the document.
Defines the location where DITA-OT places a log file for your documentation project.
Specificies the loctation of the xsl scripts used for transforming your content files. Overrides the default value of toolkitdir/xsl.

The directory where your project's ant build script resides. The DITA-OT will look for your .dita files relative to this directory. DITA-OT's default build script sets this as an attribute of the project, but you can also define it as a project property.
Specifies whether DITA-OT should delete the files in the temporary directory, dita.temp.dir, when it finishes a build.

Defines the file extension for your DITA content files. The default DITA-OT script defines this as .dita, however you may also set it to .xml if you want to write your content in free XML editor that does not understand the .dita format.

Defines the directory where DITA-OT places temporary files generated during the transformation process. The default value is the directory beneath the build script. If you generate more than one output type for your documentation, you might want to use a separate temporary directory for each output type to facilitate your debugging efforts.
The location of your DITA-OT installation. Set in the startcmd.bat script that you should run before running the ant script for your documentation project.

Specifies whether the content files are located outside the directory where your .ditamap file resides. The default value is "no". The gen-list-without-flagging Ant task generates a harmless warning for content outside the map directory; you can suppress these warnings by setting the outer.control property to "true".
Microsoft HTML Help Compiler cannot produce HTMLHelp for documentation projects that use outer content. Your content files must reside in or below the directory containing the .ditamap file, and the map file cannot specifiy ".." at the start of href attributes for topicref elements.

Defines the output type for a specific Ant target. The value of this property must be one of of the following DITA-supported values:
dita2pdf2
dita2xhtml
dita2eclipsehelp
dita2eclipsecontent
dita2troff
dita2rtf
dita2javahelp
